channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: Watch live: Education Minister Chris Hipkins discusses decision not to move school holidays
item.description: Auckland students will go on holiday at the same time as the rest of New Zealand, despite spending weeks in lockdown.
item.dc:creator: BRIDIE WITTON

item.title: Kea Kids News: An American poi star on TikTok is getting a lot of love from Kiwi fans
item.description: Jared Aldrich is a master with poi, and he's turned his talents into must-watch TikToks. He's never been to Aotearoa but his Kiwi fan base would give him a warm welcome.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Plotting our course through the strong winds of change
item.description: OPINION: An arms-length view of the three waters reforms, and a reminder of paddock-selection help for farmers.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Quiz: Take the three strikes trivia test for September 17, 2021
item.description: You get three chances to correctly rank the answers in today's question for September 17, 2021.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW SLAUGHTER

item.title: Kea Kids News: Teen poet Kyllah speaks from the heart and it's won her serious attention
item.description: Auckland schoolgirl and rising star poet Kyllah Iosua scooped a major prize at the E Te Whānau poetry competition, winning the 18 and under section — on her 12th birthday.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Missing family: Surf lifesavers searching in Marokopa pass items on to police
item.description: “Our role today is to look in every nook and cranny and get into the caves and rule out there is no evidence of them being there," Surf Lifesaving NZ's Allan Mundy said.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: How the All Blacks can return to No 1 in the world on Saturday night in Brisbane
item.description: If Rugby Championship results play out in a similar way to last weekend, the men in black will be back atop the rankings for the first time in two years.
item.dc:creator: STUFF SPORTS REPORTERS

item.title: Knickers in costly twist as mystery clothing flusher strikes
item.description: Four tops and five pairs of underpants flushed down the toilet since the start of August have caused eight blockages of pump stations in Māpua, near Nelson.
item.dc:creator: CHERIE SIVIGNON

item.title: Covid-19: Wānaka lockdown breacher's involvement in equestrian sports under review
item.description: Equestrian Sports NZ head says he hopes people will see William Willis' actions as those of an "individual, not that of the sport".
item.dc:creator: ADAM JACOBSON

item.title: As the kererū flies: the great count is on for the plump, sky-dancing birds
item.description: It's time to log all sightings of the plump, swooping birds; the eighth and final Great Kererū Count is on.
item.dc:creator: RICHARD WALKER

item.title: 'Unacceptable' building consent delays are 'stopping us from building houses'
item.description: An 11-week wait for building consent applications to be even looked at in Christchurch highlights an extreme problem affecting councils throughout the country.
item.dc:creator: COLLEEN HAWKES

item.title: Five pieces by Māori artists and designers to celebrate te wiki o te reo Māori
item.description: Celebrate te wiki o te reo Māori by bringing the work of kaiwhakanikoniko (graphic artists) and ringatoi (fine artists) into your home.
item.dc:creator: KYLIE KLEIN-NIXON

item.title: Covid-19: Foodstuffs confirms likely infectious delivery driver visited stores in Hamilton, Cambridge and Tauranga
item.description: Yet the supermarkets have not been deemed locations of interest as delivery areas are not accessible to the public.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT YEOMAN AND LUKE KIRKEBY

item.title: The Women of 9/11: Disney+ documentary looks at how some picked up their lives
item.description: This should be next on your list if you've been watching any of the 20th anniversary coverage of the September 11 attacks.
item.dc:creator: KATE ROBERTSON

item.title: 'Suspicious' fire outside south Auckland medical centre damages Covid-19 testing tents
item.description: Two Covid-19 testing tents were damaged after being set alight in Auckland, police say.
item.dc:creator: MELANIE EARLEY

item.title: Victims of Timaru homicide are three children under the age of 10
item.description: Neighbours overheard man saying 'is this really happening?' before police find three bodies at property, which is understood to be used for hospital staff.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN GUILDFORD RACHAEL COMER YASHAS SRINIVASA

item.title: Low-user electricity tariffs will be phased out over 5 years
item.description: Change likely to mean 59% of households pay about $600 a year more in fixed charges, but Government believes it will balance out.
item.dc:creator: TOM PULLAR-STRECKER

item.title: Joseph Parker out to prove his point in rematch with Dereck Chisora
item.description: December sequel in Manchester confirmed with Parker confident he can clearly dominate this time.
item.dc:creator: DUNCAN JOHNSTONE

item.title: Man in ICU after Friday morning house fire in Waitara
item.description: A man in his 40s is in ICU in hospital after an early morning fire in Waitara.
item.dc:creator: JANE MATTHEWS

item.title: Covid-19: Cook Islands approves vaccine for ages 12-15 for October roll-out
item.description: Cook Islands PM says he wants everyone eligible to get their jab: "It may save your child’s life."
item.dc:creator: TORIKA TOKALAU
